message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This report employs the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys data to examine the relationship between firms' exporting activities and financial constraints in Central Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "The study investigates the implementation of public-private partnerships (PPPs) using data from the National Public Private Partnership Unit (N3PU) in Uganda.", "dataset": ["National Public Private Partnership Unit (N3PU)"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Demographic and Health Survey dataset, this paper examines the factors affecting maternal health-seeking behaviors in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey dataset"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we analyze the effects of trade agreements by utilizing a matched firm-level dataset of Brazilian exporters called Comex Stat.", "dataset": ["Comex Stat"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This research paper constructs a novel dataset from household survey data merged with local climatic information measured at higher spatial resolution for sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["household survey data"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses data on government procurement contracts provided by the Mexican Compranet to investigate the impact of institutional corruption on public contracting outcomes.", "dataset": ["Mexican Compranet"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite observations from the Landsat program with socioeconomic data drawn from the Global Rural-Urban Mapping Project (GRUMP) to assess the impacts of urbanization on agricultural land conversion in India.", "dataset": ["Landsat program", "Global Rural-Urban Mapping Project (GRUMP)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "This research leverages a unique dataset of mobile phone metadata provided by the Telecommunications Regulatory Authority (TRA) of Bahrain to examine the travel patterns of individuals during religious pilgrimage.", "dataset": ["Telecommunications Regulatory Authority (TRA) of Bahrain"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the impact of natural disasters on household welfare, we use data from the Indonesia Family Life Survey (IFLS), combined with district-level climate data derived from the Climate Research Unit at the University of East Anglia.", "dataset": ["Indonesia Family Life Survey (IFLS)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we utilize a panel dataset that integrates firm-level data with customs transaction data to explore the effect of non-tariff measures on trade performance in developing countries.", "dataset": ["panel dataset", "customs transaction data"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This report employs the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys data to examine the relationship between firms' exporting activities and financial constraints in Central Asia.",
